summary: An email from a Deputy Chief of the Public Corruption Unit at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, scheduling a brief update meeting regarding Epstein. It indicates ongoing official interest in the Epstein case within the SDNY in early 2019.

persons.name: Deputy Chief, Public Corruption Unit
persons.context: The sender of the email from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, seeking to schedule a brief Epstein case update meeting.

events.title: Epstein Update Meeting Scheduling
events.description: A Deputy Chief from the SDNY Public Corruption Unit emails to schedule a brief update meeting regarding the Epstein case.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The email is dated January 29, 2019, indicating official activity related to the Epstein case at that time.
The communication originates from the Public Corruption Unit of the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY).
The sender, a Deputy Chief, is seeking to schedule a brief update meeting, suggesting the case was an active topic of discussion within the office.
The email is a direct, internal scheduling communication, not a substantive legal document.
